title: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description:
Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
Created attachment 25997 [details] - NioEndpoint.java and simple web applications
Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100%, and remains at 100% until the server is restarted. Reproduced with Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021. It is a duplicate of issue: Bug 46373. It seems that Jetty guys fixed that problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel. I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.
OB: The issue arises when selector.select(timeout) occasionally returns zero keys on the Linux platform.
EB: Investigation and resolution of the Nio Selector issue on Linux platform.
SR:
1. Analyze the NioEndpoint.java code to identify the root cause of selector.select(timeout) returning zero keys on Linux.
2. Develop and test a fix to address the identified issue.
3. Ensure that the server's CPU usage no longer reaches 100% due to this problem.
4. Document the fix and update relevant documentation.
5. Consider backporting the fix to affected Java versions, if applicable.
